orestes.bloomfilter.redis

Class RedisBitSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.BitSet
      • orestes.bloomfilter.redis.RedisBitSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class RedisBitSet
extends java.util.BitSet
    A persistent BitSet backed by Redis. Not all methods of the superclass are implemented. If needed they can be used converting the RedisBitSet to a regular BitSet by calling asBitSet().

    External transactions or pipeline can be propagated for use by modifying methods (e.g. set(int)).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RedisBitSet

        public RedisBitSet(java.lang.String host,
           int port,
           java.lang.String name,
           int size)
        Constructs an new RedisBitSet. It uses a new Redis connection with same host and port as the provided connection.
        Parameters:
        host - the Redis host
        port - the Redis Port
        name - the name used as key in the database
        size - the initial size of the RedisBitSet

    • Method Detail

      • useContext

        public void useContext(redis.clients.jedis.Pipeline p)
        Uses an external Redis pipeline context for all subsequent modifying operations (like set(int)) until leaveContext() is called.
        Parameters:
        p - The propagated Redis pipeline

      • useContext

        public void useContext(redis.clients.jedis.Transaction t)
        Uses an external Redis transaction context for all subsequent modifying operations (like set(int)) until leaveContext() is called.
        Parameters:
        t - The propagated Redis transaction

        public boolean[] getBulk(int... indexes)

        Returns:
        an array containing the values at the given index positions
